column11: The technologies, languages, and frameworks section is very useful information
column12: It could be useful to have a list of which job titles are asking for which skills and qualifications.
column15: The sample size is somewhat small so it is hard to draw conclusions based on the data.
column18: Grids on the bar charts in most sections would make the information easier to see.

column11: The number of available jobs in specific locations & concise data of the most desireable hard skills for the tech industry
column12: Perhaps a trend in availability of jobs in certain cities/areas of the country in the near future based on recent openings. For example, an increase or decrease in available jobs in Manchester.
column15: Whilst the sources are likely credible, it might be useful to include more. A broader set of sources could provide higher reliability and cover a wider spectrum of job openings.
column18: I can think of nothing particularly important. Perhaps an indication there is more data if you scroll down, but this is nitpicking.

column11: Location and the increase / decrease trends
column18: From a data visualisation standpoint, I would hope it would only display the exact value (not the coding attached) when hovering over a specific element/bar. However, this is not major. Also would consider adding a negative axis on the decrease trends tab.

column11: The most useful is the Hard Skills, and the Technologies/Frameworks/Languages sections.
column12: Perhaps information mapping average salaries to the data, for example average salary for each item in the hard skills section or for the Technologies/Frameworks/Languages section. Or even per region as London famously pays higher salaries but would be interesting to see if there is variation between other cities.
Perhaps whether jobs require previous work experience (especially those which are entry level)
Perhaps whether jobs require previous work experience (especially those which are entry level)

column18: No it's simple view. More important is the quality of the information

column11: Identifying the top 20 hard skills which shows me which ones I should put more time towards getting better at
column12: Data on employment statistics maybe from different degrees or masters and different universities and different areas so you could see where to look for employment with a better chance
column15: I’m not sure how many people the data has been collected from and whether it has been collected on a large enough scale to be credible

column11: Identifying the most useful educational requirements from the dashboard

column12: Salary, WFH/in office, average applications if possible
column15: Indeed has a lot of spam jobs and can easily be manipulated if wanted
column18: Could make it more colourful/different range of graphs

column15: The colour scheme of the website
column18: Make it more compatible with Mobile devices
